Subject: Re: Multiple Extractor instances of same class

Somewhat related: I have a custom queue-assignment-policy class and am
annoyed that I have to patch AbstractFrontier in order to avoid a
"Value not in legal values list" when editing my crawl configuration
from the WUI.  I want to be able to change other values in my
configuration and let my custom value stay what it is even if it's not
in the "legal values list".  I'm not sure if the same thing holds true
for processors, but that would be even more annoying.

Thanks,
eric

On Mon, Jan 22, 2007 at 12:44:54PM -0600, Eric wrote:
> It would be nice if one could have multiple instances of the same
> Extractor class in their processing chain.  In the case of
> configuration-heavy extractors one may want two differently configured
> but same class extractors.  Maybe Processor.options should key on the
> name instead of the class or something...
> 
> eric
>

> http://ir.iit.edu/~ej
